algorithmSettings.name: number_of_samples
algorithmSettings.description: Positive integer (if individual, total simulations is this times each variable)

algorithmSettings.name: failed_f_value
algorithmSettings.description: Return Value for F(x) if F fails

measures.name: build_existing_model
measures.description: Builds the OpenStudio Model for an existing building.
measures.modeler_description: Builds the OpenStudio Model using the sampling csv file, which contains the specified parameters for each existing building. Based on the supplied building number, those parameters are used to run the OpenStudio measures with appropriate arguments and build up the OpenStudio model.

arguments.name: building_id
arguments.description: The building number (between 1 and the number of samples).

arguments.name: number_of_buildings_represented
arguments.description: The total number of buildings represented by the existing building models.

arguments.name: workflow_json
arguments.description: The name of the JSON file (in the resources dir) that dictates the order in which measures are to be run. If not provided, the order specified in resources/options_lookup.tsv will be used.

measures.name: apply_upgrade
measures.description: Measure that applies an upgrade (one or more child measures) to a building model based on the specified logic.
measures.modeler_description: Determines if the upgrade should apply to a given building model. If so, calls one or more child measures with the appropriate arguments.

arguments.name: upgrade_name
arguments.description: User-specificed name that describes the upgrade.

arguments.name: option_1
arguments.description: Specify the parameter|option as found in resources\options_lookup.tsv.

arguments.name: option_1_apply_logic
arguments.description: Logic that specifies if the Option 1 upgrade will apply based on the existing building's options. Specify one or more parameter|option as found in resources\options_lookup.tsv. When multiple are included, they must be separated by '||' for OR and '&&' for AND, and using parentheses as appropriate. Prefix an option with '!' for not.

arguments.name: option_1_cost_1_value
arguments.description: Total option 1 cost is the sum of all: (Cost N Value) x (Cost N Multiplier).

arguments.name: option_1_cost_1_multiplier
arguments.description: Total option 1 cost is the sum of all: (Cost N Value) x (Cost N Multiplier).

arguments.name: option_1_cost_2_value
arguments.description: Total option 1 cost is the sum of all: (Cost N Value) x (Cost N Multiplier).

arguments.name: option_1_cost_2_multiplier
arguments.description: Total option 1 cost is the sum of all: (Cost N Value) x (Cost N Multiplier).

measures.name: building_characteristics_report
measures.description: Reports building characteristics for each simulation.
measures.modeler_description: Based on the mode specified, the Meta-Measure will use the appropriate probability distribution files (as found in its resources subdirectory).

measures.name: timeseries_csv_export
measures.description: Exports all available hourly timeseries enduses to csv, and uses them for utility bill calculations.
measures.modeler_description: Exports all available hourly timeseries enduses to csv, and uses them for utility bill calculations.

measures.name: server_directory_cleanup
measures.description: Removes a significant portion of the saved results from each run, helping to alleviate memory problems.
measures.modeler_description: Use during large server runs, when individual sequel files and the like will not be needed.
